item.title: The Art of Being a Coauthor
item.description: The Art of Being a Coauthor So You Have Been Invited to Be a Coauthor—Congratulations! Most likely, even before contributing to the writing, you’ve already played a significant role, perhaps by providing key data, technical expertise, or essential resources. This is a rewarding moment, as it signifies that your contribution is recognized and valued. However, with this recognition comes a responsibility to support the progress of the paper or proposal. In reality, most of the writing and heavy lifting is carried out by one or two lead authors, who are often PhD students or postdocs.
